Trial_Design.evidence: Participants will be randomised into two surgical groups (RIMA-SVG vs Ao-SVG).

Participants.evidence: This non-inferiority, single-centre, prospective, double-blind, randomised clinical trial will enrol 300 patients undergoing CABG.

Intervention.evidence: Participants will be randomised into two surgical groups (RIMA-SVG vs Ao-SVG).

Objective.evidence: This study aims to determine whether the RIMA-SVG technique is non-inferior to the conventional Aorta (Ao)-SVG approach in terms of 1-year graft patency, while also comparing perioperative complications and short-term clinical outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome is the 1-year SVG patency rate, assessed using coronary CT angiography.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation will be computer-generated, and all procedures will be performed by experienced surgeons.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This non-inferiority, single-centre, prospective, double-blind, randomised clinical trial will enrol 300 patients undergoing CABG.

Harms.evidence: Secondary outcomes include perioperative complications, all-cause mortality, major adverse cardiovascular and cerebrovascular events (MACCE), and surgical site infections occurring during hospitalisation and up to 1 year postoperatively.
